channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1633; 08:05PM; 3450 E Estrada St; MAP: https://bit.ly/46mnl4e; #BoyleHeights; After knocking back a significant amount of heat with a transitional attack, firefighters advanced hose lines inside to get water on the seat of the fire and search the structure for any occupants. It took 32 firefighters 23 minutes to extinguish the flames. Two patients had already evacuated the structure, but were unsure if anyone else was inside. Search teams found one canine pet deceased inside. No other occupants were found inside. Paramedics provided a medical assessment on scene for the two that evacuated. Both were found to be in good condition, but one of them (12-year-old female) was transported for a medical checkup, after the traumatic experience of fleeing the fire. A total of 10 people were displaced from the home (6 adults, 4 children). Red Cross is responding to assist them and a SAVE Card has been issued on scene to help with immediate financial needs. Cause under investigation. Nothing further.; FS 25; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E2 E202 E447 E458 EA1 FR91 RA17 RA25 SO1 T2 T9; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Update Physical Rescue; INC#1678; 09:00PM; 17800 W Parthenia St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3usvOoZ; #Northridge; One vehicle collided with a wall, causing the driver (solo occupant) to be trapped. As crews attempted to extricate the patient, sadly, the patient was found to be deceased among the wreckage. Firefighters will remain on scene and assist with body recovery efforts to assist LAPD and the Medical Examiner. LAPD Inc 3782. Nothing further.; FS 103; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 E103 E273 E70 E73 EM15 HR3 RA70 RA73 T73 UR88; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Physical Rescue; INC#1678; 08:05PM; 17800 W Parthenia St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3usvOoZ; #Northridge; Vehicle versus wall with one patient trapped. Fire crews, including Urban Search and Rescue specialists, are working to extricate one patient from the wreckage. LAPD Inc #3782.; FS 103; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 E103 E273 E70 E73 EM15 HR3 RA70 RA73 T73 UR88; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1633; 07:42PM; 3456 E Estrada St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3G5t97p; #BoyleHeights; One-story single-family home with heavy fire showing. Crews used a transitional attack, and then moved to an offensive (interior) attack. [Transitional Attack: When there is heavy fire or turbulent smoke (imminent flashover) presenting from any door or window, a firefighter can direct a straight stream at a steep angle toward to ceiling. Controlled studies have shown this method greatly increases survivability inside the structure, as firefighters transition to interior attack.]; FS 25; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E2 E202 E447 E458 FR91 RA17 RA25 T2 T9; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1106; 03:17PM; 5437 W Lemon Grove Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/47j3uEm; #Hollywood; Thankfully, reports of people trapped inside were unconfirmed by firefighters, who performed a primary search (complete) and secondary search (second set of eyes to double check) inside for victims, but found no one. It took 38 firefighters 19 minutes to extinguish the flames consuming the vacant duplex. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 E227 E229 E235 E27 E29 E52 E82 RA29 RA52 RA82 SO1 T27 T29 T35; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1106; 02:58PM; 5447 W Lemon Grove Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SM0VX1; #Hollywood; Two-story vacant (boarded-up) duplex with fire showing. Offensive mode.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 E227 E229 E27 E52 E82 RA29 RA52 RA82 T27 T29; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Elevator Rescue; INC#1719; 11:30PM; 1260 S Figueroa St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uhQ2Su; #DowntownLA; *Correction* Prior to being transported to the hospital, both patients refused transport by LAFD ambulances.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E201 E203 E209 E210 E211 RA13 RA9 T1 T10 T11 T3 T9; CH7; 12 14; Nicholas Prange

Elevator Rescue; INC#1719; 09:59PM; 1260 S Figueroa St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3uhQ2Su; #DowntownLA; A power outage in a 37-story high-rise building caused all 14 elevators to become inoperable. Firefighters systematically checked each elevator throughout the building and rescued at least 6 people trapped by the power outage. Two patients (adult males) were transported to the hospital with non-life-threatening medical complaints. Thankfully the power has been restored and there is no additional hazard. Nothing further.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E201 E203 E209 E210 E211 RA9 T1 T10 T11 T3 T9; CH7; 12 14; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1762; 10:59PM; 8600 N International Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SMo9fE; #CanogaPark; Fire involving two upstairs units in a two-story garden-style apartment building was extinguished by 32 firefighters in 21 minutes. One patient was transported to a local hospital (63-year-old female with minor injuries) and one patient was evaluated and released on scene (33-year-old male). No firefighter injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC10 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E103 E104 E106 E273 E296 E305 E72 EM15 EM17 RA104 RA106 RA896 RA96 T105 T73 T96; CH8; 17 18; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1762; 10:38PM; 8600 N International Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3SMo9fE; #CanogaPark; Large two-story garden-style apartment building with fire showing from the second floor. Offensive mode.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC10 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E103 E104 E106 E273 E296 E305 E72 EM15 EM17 RA104 RA106 RA896 RA96 T105 T73 T96; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange
